content.question: Consider all lines in the <math alttext="x y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane that pass through both the origin and a point <math alttext="x comma y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> on the graph of <math alttext="y equals, x squared, minus x, plus 16" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="1 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The figure above shows one such line and the graph of <math alttext="y equals, x squared, minus x, plus 16" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: The line with minimum slope passes through the graph of <math alttext="y equals, x squared, minus x, plus 16" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The line with minimum slope passes through the graph of <math alttext="y equals, x squared, minus x, plus 16" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The line with minimum slope passes through the graph of <math alttext="y equals, x squared, minus x, plus 16" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 7" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The line with minimum slope passes through the graph of <math alttext="y equals, x squared, minus x, plus 16" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The line with minimum slope passes through the graph of <math alttext="y equals, x squared, minus x, plus 16" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
